Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: தொட்டனைத் தூறும் மணற்கேணி மாந்தர்க்குக் கற்றனைத் தூறும் அறிவு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: In sandy soil, when deep you delve, you reach the springs below; The more you learn, the freer streams of wisdom flow.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A side-by-side comparison. On the left, a person is digging into sandy soil ('மணற்கேணி'). The deeper they dig, the more crystal-clear water springs forth.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, a person is deeply engrossed in studying a book. The more they read, the brighter and more profusely a river of light, representing knowledge ('அறிவு'), flows from the book and into their mind.
Layered_Composition.Background: Both scenes are set in a vast, open landscape, suggesting this is a universal principle of effort and reward.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A direct visual analogy: just as digging deeper in sand reveals more water, learning more deeply reveals more knowledge.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The sandy well ('மணற்கேணி') and its springing water are a direct parallel to the book and the flowing river of light (knowledge). The depth of the digging/learning corresponds to the amount of water/knowledge.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Bright, clear, natural light. The water is pristine and clear. The river of knowledge is a brilliant, flowing stream of golden-white light.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A balanced, wide shot that presents the two scenes as a clear and direct comparison.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with magical realism for the river of light.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Natural daylight, with the river of light being a secondary, magical light source.

Negative_Prompt: muddy water, dark light from the book, lazy figures, text artifacts, cartoonish.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the visual effect of the river of light.
